messages.body:
Gene, 

Thank you very much for deciding to join our auditioning
program, I must tell you it has not been easy for us here. There are
lots of young talents out there to be discovered and we make it our
prime objective to look for them and give them the opportunity they
truly deserve.  We have over 500 candidates applying for a spot in
this movie but we need only six of you which means we are only looking
for the best. Out of the six remaining spots there are still two key
characters available for grabs so if you work hard enough you might be
among the lucky ones to get the part.

We are going to send you a temporal form for you to fill now, please
fill it carefully for it will be used to access you. We will be
sending you the complete package consisting of your application form,
script, traveling documents etc later i.e. when we are sure you are
the right person for the part.

For each available part we have we will be inviting five candidates
for the finale auditions in Lagos Nigeria so I must inform you, its
going to be a bumpy ride all the way to the last audition day. This
trip to Nigeria will be sponsored by universal studios i.e. your hotel
accommodation and flight will be paid for by us so you don't have to
bug yourself about the bills.

I wish you good luck with your efforts and believe with hard work and
dedication you can achieve a lot. We will be sending you an
application form to fill, as soon as you get it fill it and send it
back to us. We will discuss about your amenities when you get the
part, we will need to see what you are made of.

 

Regards, 

Eddie Curtis.

messages.body:
Dearest Eddie,

Thanks again for your prompt response.  I'm really thrilled that you people
are taking so much care to ensure my comfort.  In general, I require a
24' Strait Truck for use as my trailer.  I can forward you my requested
brands if you need them.  Inside the truck I will need a standard makeup
station, with full lights.  I intend to bring my own makeup artist, as
well as my own Chinese Shar Pei.

For my own dining purposes, I only eat raw food.  Please see the menu
at my favorite restaurant at http://www.huvafenfushi.com/pdf/All_Menu/Raw_Food_Menu.pdf

I would be happy with any number of choices from there.  Unfortunately,
the Shar Pei will only eat cooked meats.  I shall look for some local
eateries in Lagos and suggest a place where you can find take out
for him.

As I have many allergies, it is of the utmost importance that there are
no flowers of any kind in the trailer.  In addition, I am allergic to
nuts, strawberries, rawhide-coated baseballs, polyurethane, and Protactinium.

I'm accustomed to all of my drinks being served to me in a 14.5oz cup,
with a "bendy" straw-- that is a straw that bends 4/5ths of the way towards
the top so as to make for easy sipping.

How long will principal photography last?  I need to know if it will run
afoul of my neighborhood watch annual meeting.

You mentioned that you were able to adapt to the weather change.  Does this
mean you are currently in Nigeria?  If so, what are your hours of working?
I imagine the time difference must be at least 30 hours?

More to come.

Sincerely,
Gene

messages.body:
>1.Why do you think you are the next movie star?

It's not why I think I will be the next movie star--It's why I
know I will be the next movie star.  I have overcome many
difficulties in my life: Illness (Rhinovirus, etc.), Poverty (B&W TV,
etc.), Hunger and others.  If I can overcome these things, I know I
can win this.  In addition, I can take these experiences and harness
them to deliver a performance that nobody will ever forget.

>2.To what extent can you go for your acting career?

I will do most anything for my acting career.  I will even do frontal
nudity, but not rear.

>3.A personal mission statement describing your personal goals

As I have mentioned in previous e-mail, I have already achieved most
of my personal goals.  I have made all of the money I will ever need,
and my current goals all revolve around enjoying life.  I want to do
things that challenge myself.  So, in closing, my mission is to eat
cheese (so to speak)

>4.Is your family/loved ones supportive of your acting career and to
>what extent have they gone to help?

I've lost everyone who was once important to me.  Money does that to
people.

>5.Is it convenient for you to leave/travel out of the country to do 
>a movie?

Not only is it convenient, it is imperative.  I'd rather not get into
the details of that.

>6. Do you have any special needs health wise/medically or is there
>anything you think we should know about you?

I have already given you my requirements for once principal shooting
begins.  There's plenty you should know about me, but all will be
become clear over time.

Gene

>Eddy Curtis

P.S.  Is it Eddy or Eddie??

Congratulations you are among the few candidates short listed for the
Lagos auditions. Like I said before it's not going to be easy out
there and we expect the best from you. We invested a lot in this
project and will like you to be part of the team.

We believe most of you out there are not professional so we have taken
the time to make the process a lot easier for you. A day to the
auditions we are organizing a trip to various shot locations for the
movie for you to have a feel of a real movie scenario.

We believe it will inspire you to do much better and once we achieve
that our work will be a lot easier.

We expect you to be in Lagos two days before the auditions; we will be
mailing you a parcel containing the necessary documents needed for the
auditions. Inside this parcel includes:

 

1.      Application form.

2.      Your traveling documents.

3.      Audition Script.

4.      Documents containing information about the movie.

 

We will like you to have these documents prior to your arrival in
Lagos, this will enable you prepare better for the auditions. Our
admin manager, Mr. Kelvin Nwosu, will be contacting you very soon,
give him all the information he needs to enable him prepare your
traveling documents.

If there is need for additional information, we will contact
you. Thanks for making this project successful, I wish you good luck
in your preparations. I will get to meet you in person when you come
to Nigeria, we can discuss better when we meet in person. The
auditions will only be for five days and i dont think you will be
needing a vacination.

Eddie Curtis
